intro: Listera shaoi, commonly known as the Shaoi basketwort, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its botanical features include a short stem, hairy foliage, and a unique flowering pattern that occurs in early spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Listera shaoi is considered a species of conservation concern.
